loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Magie is a 46-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She has provided the needs of her 3 children from the little amount of 6,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her fish vending business for 6 years. This business serves as an aid to the income gained from her husband who does fishing. However, this year she joined GDMPC and she is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother of one child. She is 49 years old and resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Philippines. Elena has grown rice for sale to earn a living for 11 years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Recently, Elena joined GDMPC. In the future, Elena wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pedro and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gloria operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, pork, vegetables, chicken, fish and other ingredients. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gloria hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, vegetables, chicken, fish and other ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a small scale farmer from Mabonde location, Kitale County in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for ten years now and sells her maize, beans and tea to the local market. She earns additional income by baking and selling cakes to the local market.

Carolyne is thirty-five years old and married with 6 children aged between one and sixteen years old. Three of the children are currently attending school.

She has made a loan request of 31,200 KES (Kenyan shillings) through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that her milk production will increase and she will be able to have enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help in paying school fees for her children and meeting her basic needs. She hopes that in the next five years she will have acquired three dairy cows and set up a poultry farm. Poor market prices and bad weather conditions have been her primary challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leticia Johanna

texts.es:
Leticia Johanna tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil Divorciada tiene tres hijos, vive  con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Leticia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño e s poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Leticia Johanna, 31, is divorced and has three children.  She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  El Guasmo Communal Bank is located in the Agua Fría area of Mocache in Mocache Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Leticia makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  She's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to buy what she needs for her crops.  She'll make her purchases in the Mocache area.

Her dream is to be able to buy plots of land to continue planting.  In her free time she likes to clean the house.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 39 years old and lives in the town of Paidah in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children; two of them are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Adam has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells secondhand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Adam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for re-sale and will help Adam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Adam hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another side business with the loan. 

Adam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Adam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Elmie, age 29, is married with two kids. She is an entrepreneur in Panduma, Tukuran and is earning income from her transport service business. She started it almost 2 years ago and she earns PHP 3,000 per month. To improve the business, she borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined in 2010 to obtain rickshaw accessories and tires. Before long, Elmie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain rickshaw accessories and tires.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Forty-year-old Isaac is married and has 4 children who are all in school. He works in agriculture, especially coffee-growing, to meet his family's needs as well as those of his aged parents. Coffee is a major cash crop in the area he lives. Through coffee, his father got money to educate him and his siblings, and through the same coffee, he is educating his children and has bought a small piece of land to expand his coffee plantation. He sells his coffee to processors because it is still in small quantities but his dream is to be able to process it himself at the local factory and transport it to the city. The main challenges are price fluctuations and the constant rains which do not give the coffee an opportunity to dry properly since Isaac solely depends on sunshine. High transport costs to the factory also encroach on his profits, leaving him with barely enough income to meet his costs.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
This is Ma. Loida, 55, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Bernardo, a businessman and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Loida oversees operations of their pedicab transportation business. She owns seven pedicabs that carry up to four passengers each to their destination within the community. The pedicab driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to paint the pedicabs and also for the maintenance of them. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Loida dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their pedicab unit.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 38 years old, married to Joseph, and blessed with four children. She has run a retail shop business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 38,000. 

This is her 3rd loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking fat, and washing detergents and also set up a food cafe.

She intends to use the profits gained to diversify and grow her business. Her future plan is to become a large-scale outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking fat, and washing detergents and also set up a food cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more cloth to re-sell.

loans.name: Kyabolokya Women Group

texts.en: Specioza is a thirty-eight year old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Fourteen years ago she decided to invest in a retail shop and has since reaped tangible benefits such as the ability to pay school fees for her children and purchase land. She has many customers since her business is located on the Congo-Uganda border. Inadequate capital and price fluctuation are her major hardships while her dream is to open another outlet. Specioza intends to use the money to buy fish, palm oil, sugar, soap and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil, sugar, soap and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Reynaldo

texts.es:
SEGUNDO REYNALDO tiene 48 años de estado civil Unión Libre  tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los la familia y en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
SEGUNDO REYNALDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Reynaldo, 48, is in a common-law relationship and has 4 children. He lives with his family in Ventanas in the province of Rios. The “El Guasmo” communal bank is located in the district of Agua Fria de Mocache, in the canton of Mocache, which is known for agriculture and livestock.
Segundo Reynaldo is a farmer who sows corn. He is requesting a loan to buy insecticide, urea and herbicide. 

With the help of the loan, he can buy what is necessary for the crops. He’ll make the purchase in the district of Mocache. His dream is to buy a parcel of land. In his spare time, he enjoys going out with his family.

loans.use: buy insecticide, urea and herbicide.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Muy conocida y querida en su pueblo es Aydee, es una gran mujer, madre de Deyvis de 1 año. A sus 21 años logró independizarse parar brindarle a su pequeño lo mejor a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Vive actualmente en una vivienda construida a base de adobe en calidad de alquiler.
Lleva 7 años en el rubro de la producción gracias a unas parcelas que sus padres le brindaron para poder ella generar sus propios ingresos, por medio de la plantación de cacao y otros productos de la zona. Admite que no es una tarea fácil puesto que en la mayoría de ocasiones convoca a jornaleros de la zona para las tareas de retiro de maleza que compiten con los árboles de cacao por los nutrientes necesarios para un óptimo crecimiento de las mazorcas.
Se siente muy contenta por como le va con sus plantaciones ya que ha transcurrido un tiempo considerable desde que no es aquejada por ningún mal o enfermedad tropical que perjudican directamente a sus plantaciones, no obstante la temporada de lluvias son un gran impedimento para el normal desempeño de sus labores debido a que su parcela se encuentra en un zona que presenta cierta inclinación.
Luego de todos estos años de trabajo, se le presentó una buena oportunidad para la adquisición de un lote de terreno que tanto anhela y que planea a futuro poder al fin iniciar la construcción de su vivienda propia, esto solo para iniciar con algo propio puesto que sus metas a largo plazo apuntan realizar la compra de una parcela mas grande con la cual pueda iniciarse en la producción de achiote, palillo y maíz. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, al ver que en su localidad se reunían personas que comentaban estar muy contentas por el eficiente trabajo con los microcréditos no lo dudo y quiso integrarse inmediatamente. Al ser su primera experiencia agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida y por la motivación que imparten.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará el dinero que tiene destinado para la compra de un pequeño lote para la futura construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aydee is well known and liked in her town. She is a great woman, and mother to Deyvis who is one year old. When she was 21 years old she was able to become independent, so that she could provide her little one with the best possible, as a result of her work and efforts. She currently lives in an adobe home, which she is renting. 

She has seven years of experience cultivating cacao and other local products, thanks to a piece of land that her parents provided her with to be able to make her own income. She admits that it is not easy work, and that it is often necessary to hire local day laborers to remove unwanted plants that compete for the nutrients that are needed by the cacao trees in order for the fruit to have optimal growth.  

She is happy with her crops because a good amount of time has passed since her plants have been afflicted by anything bad or by tropical disease that directly harm cacao plantations. However, the rainy season does affect the normal care of the crop because the plot of land is positioned on an incline.  

After all of these years of work, she has been presented with a good opportunity to buy a plot of land that will finally allow her to work towards her future plans of building her own home. This is only something to start with, since her long term goals include buying a bigger piece of property where she can start planting crops of achiote (also called annatto), turmeric and corn.

This is the first loan she has taken out through MFP. She heard about micro-loans from people in her town, who said they were very happy with the efficiency of the micro-loans; she believed their comments and wanted to become a community bank member immediately. As it is her first experience with loans, she is thankful to the other community bank members for how they have welcomed her and the motivation they share. 

With the 500 nuevos soles, she will add to the money she already had set aside for the purchase of a small plot of land for the future construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land for her home.

loans.name: Los Humildes Group

texts.es: El señor Donaldo tiene 69 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Los Humildes, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es una persona honrada y responsable. El inicio su negocio desde hace 30 años, se dedica a la venta de nieves o helados, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm, la ventaja es que el producto lo ofrece a domicilio y es de muy buena calidad. El préstamo que el señor Donaldo solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de caramelo, dulce, saborizante, entre otros productos de uso exclusivo para elaborar las nieves de helado. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. El único problema que enfrenta el señor Donaldo es en el tiempo de invierno que sus ventas bajan, ya que para esa temporada los clientes no le compran en gran cantidad por el frio. Su meta es poder tener su negocio bien establecido y tener su propio local para ya no salir a vender de forma ambulante. Es el cuarto financiamiento que don Donaldo solicita en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Donaldo, 69, is a member of the “Los Humildes” (The Humble Ones) communal bank.  He’s married and has two children.  His wife is a housewife.  He’s an honest, responsible person.  He started his business 30 years ago.  He sells ice-cream or frozen treats from 8am until 3pm.  His advantage is that the product he sells is of very high quality and he sells it door to door.  The loan Donaldo is requesting is to buy caramel, sweetener and flavoring agents among other products exclusively used to make ice-cream.  With support from the loan, he will be able to offer more products to his customers.  The only problem Donaldo faces is that sales drop in winter because customers don’t buy much during that season due to the cold weather.  His goal is to have a well-established business and to have his own locale so as not to have to go out selling door to door anymore.  This is Donaldo’s 4th FAMA loan request and to date he’s made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy caramel, sweetner, flavoring agents, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Jacqueline

texts.es:
MAYRA JACQUELINE tiene 31 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con unos familiares y con los hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

MAYRA JACQUELINE es costurera. Solicita el crédito para comprar una maquina industrial cosedora. tela, hilos, botones. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar materiales para trabajar en el taller.

Las compras lo hara en Guaranda. El sueño es tener una casa propia. En el titmpo libre le gusta dedicarce a los hijos.
texts.en: Mayra Jacqueline, 31, is a single mother of two children.  She lives with relatives and with her children who are 14 and 10 years old in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  She’s a seamstress and is asking for the loan to buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, thread and buttons.  With help from the loan she will buy materials needed to work in her shop.  She will make her purchases in Guaranda.  Her dream is to own a house.  She likes to dedicate her free time to her children.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more string beans to resell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж таксист и его доход не позволяет обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Манзура планирует организовать свой бизнес и получать доход, так как ей не обходимо найти источник дохода. Год за годом дети требуют все больше благ. Питание, одежда, образование-все требует массу денег. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей женских одежд. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Manzura is a very industrious and goal-driven woman.  She's married and is raising four children.  Her husband is a taxi driver but his salary is not sufficient to meet all of the family's needs.  Manzura needs to find a source of income, so she plans to start her own business.  The children demand more comfort by the year: food, clothing, education, all cost a lot of money.  So, Manzura took a course on "Achieving Success" offered by the Businesswomen's Association and got a certificate.  Now she can really start and be successful in her own business.  She wants to buy and sell women's clothing and plans to use the income to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food.  Manzura is seeking a loan for 10,000 soms to buy startup merchandise for the new business and is awaiting your beneficence.

loans.use: to buy clothing to start a new business.

loans.name: Urima

texts.en: Urima is 49 years old and married, with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, ta'amu, and bananas, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Urima needs a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, filings, and an axe for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Urima will use the profits from her sales to support her children and her family members.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, filings, and an axe.

loans.name: Ludovichus

texts.en:
Ludovichus is a 32-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 1 to 11 years old. He describes himself to be a visionary and humble man.

He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are businesspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy another motorcycle, along with some savings he had. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle, which will partly be paid for with his savings.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is married with three children.  She  sells vegetables like garden eggs, peppers and tomatoes at Abura market.   She has been selling vegetables for some years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home.   

Sarah will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs and peppers for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to mount a stall for the sale of her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs and peppers for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and sewing equipment..

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is married to a mason and has 3 children. She sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat and fish stew. Juliana has been selling waakye for 11 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Juliana needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye. With her new profits, Juliana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of waakye.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku and Ga kenkey for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in Abura. She is married and has 4 dependents. Ekua has been in this business for 4 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their children. Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku and kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku and kenkey for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en: Luisito is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old. Luisito is married and has one child. To make a living, Luisito owns and operates a bicycle transport service. Luisito has been engaged in his business for 5 years and earns PHP 4,000 per month for these activities. Luisito is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase spare parts and accessories for his bicycle. In 2011, Luisito joined GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for his bicycle.

loans.name: Fouisto

texts.en:
Fouisto is 50 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Fouisto has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells dry food such as beans, maize flour, and nuts. 

To help expand his business, Fouisto has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry products such as maize flour and beans that will have to be sold, and will help Fouisto to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs such as good. Fouisto hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his profits so he can better care for his family. 

Fouisto is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fouisto who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dry products such as maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 54 years old and married. She lives in Militar, Tukuran with her 5 children. She earns a living through fruit vending. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns PHP 4,000 per month from this work. Pacita has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 with GDMPC to buy more fruit to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 46-year-old married man with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not meet the day to day needs of his family he decided to set up a retail shop and also sells bananas as additional income. Like all good fathers, he dreams of educating his children through college and setting up sustainable income-generating activities for them. High license fees and inadequate capital to meet demand are his major challenges. He dreams of having a wholesale shop. Jackson is requesting money to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, and washing and bathing soaps to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, and washing and bathing soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the flower garden.

loans.name: Concefta

texts.en:
Concefta is only twenty four years old and already doing well in her farming business. This passionate farmer is married to Mr. Cornelius and together they have been blessed with one 3-year-old child. She has been in this business for three years now and from the look in her eyes you can tell how passionate she is about farming. Her mixed farm, which is located in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya, produces milk, vegetables, eggs, and chickens which are all sold locally.

Concefta (pictured with her favorite dairy cow) has made her first loan request through Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She intends to use this loan to buy additional chickens and chicken feeds for her poultry farm. The income from the sale of eggs will boost her family's income and improve their livelihood. She plans to expand her dairy and poultry farm in the near future to increase her income. Her challenges are animal diseases and the high cost of farm inputs, which affects her production.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 55 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. For the past 20 years, Mila has been working hard to manage his cow business, which sells cattle. 

To help expand his business, Mila has requested a loan of 3000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more cattle to sell, thereby generating greater profits that he can use to take care of his family and pay his medical bills. Mila hopes that in the future he will be able to become the richest man in town. 

Mila is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mila who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chairs to offer for rent.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Michael has been working hard to manage his small business, which does welding. 

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more metal materials to make doors and windows. This will help Michael generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Michael hopes that in the future he will be able to send his children to a better school. 

Michael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Michael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more metal materials to make doors and windows.

loans.name: C80303 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Frodauward is 28 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. He runs a general store with products such as rice, beans, potatoes, sugar, and soap. The store is well organized. He works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day of the week. He has three years of experience in this work and he employs one person to help him. Frodauward is the leader of the group, which is called “C80303 TUZAMURANE” in the local language, and he is pictured above in the middle with a paper in his hand.		

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more rice, beans, potatoes, sugar, soap, etc. to re-sell. With the profits from the loan, Frodauward will reinvest in his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans, potatoes, sugar, soap, etc. to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gs Filipenses 4.13 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Noemí se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta abarroteria, ella cuenta con mas 10 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Noemí es una persona muy trabajadora, ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona y a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, Noemí se a sabido ganar la clientela porque su manera de atenderlos es muy especial y su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estratégico donde pasa gran cantidad de personas, ella tambien cuenta con un molino de maíz, el cual atiende muy temprano.
Doña Noemi el préstamo lo invertirá en compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, huevos, pan, café, azúcar, pollo, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, harina, jabón, papel higiénico, detergentes y otros productos de consumo básico.
Con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Noemí, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, ella sueña con surtir su negocio y poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder mejorar su casa de habitación.
Noemi está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Limne La fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio la venta de nacatamales y ropa americana, desde hace 6 años y Francia Su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio venta de nacatamales, pan hornado, rosquillas desde hace 6 años.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Noemí’s a merchant; her main activity is selling groceries.  She has more than ten years’ experience running her business.  Noemí’s a very hardworking person and has a local clientele; she’s succeeded in getting ahead by means of her business because it’s been one of her main sources of income.  Noemí has known how to win over her customers by giving them very special treatment and her store is located in a very strategic point with many passersby.  She also has a corn mill that she tends to very early.

Noemí will use the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, lard, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, chicken, meats, canned goods, dairy products, flour, soap, toilet paper, detergent and other common use items.  With support from the loan Noemí gets she will be able to have a better business to cover household expenses and provide better quality of life for her family.  She dreams with stocking the store and to be able to save up enough to be able to do some home improvements.

Noemí is asking for a group loan with the following people: Limne whose main source of income for six years has been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and American clothing and Francia whose main source of income for the last six years has come from selling nacatamales, baked bread and donuts.

Danlí, El Paraíso, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio es trabajador en un beneficio de café desde hace 5 años, aunque él ya contaba con experiencia en este cultivo ya que su familia se ha dedicado a la producción del mismo desde hace varios años. Sergio y su esposa Josefina trabajan por las tardes en su finca de café y entregan año con año toda su producción a la "Unión Regional de Huatusco" pues pertenecen a esta asociación. Para la siguiente cosecha Sergio necesita un crédito para el pago de cortadores de café que contratará pues como hay demasiado trabajo no le será posible realizarlo unicamente con su esposa. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. A Sergio le gustaría aumentar su producción y para que eso sea posible acaba de sembrar hace unos mees nueva planta de café la cual comenzará a dar frutos dentro de 3 años. Al termino de la cosecha a Sergio le gustaría arreglar su casa, pues ya le hace falta pintarla y algunos detalles en los baños.
texts.en: Sergio has worked for a coffee cooperative for five years although he already had experience with this crop since his family has worked growing it for many years.  Sergio and his wife, Josefina, work afternoons in their coffee farm and turn over their entire yearly harvest to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative] because they are members of this association.  Sergio needs a loan to pay for laborers to pick coffee in the next harvest season because there is too much work to do and he can’t do it all himself with just his wife’s help.  He will repay the loan at the end of harvest.  Sergio would like to increase production and to do so he must plant new coffee plants in a few months that will start to bear fruit in three years.  At the end of harvest, Sergio would like to do some home improvements; it needs to be painted and needs some details in the bathrooms.

loans.use: to hire staff.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is 45 years old and is married with three children between 10 and 23 years old. He owns a sewing business and his business is well organized. He employs four people to help him. Ildephonse has seven years of experience in this business. He works from 7 a.m until 8 p.m every day except Sundays. 

Ildephonse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more machines for his sewing business. With the profit from the loan, Ildephonse will save for his future, get more food for his family, and pay medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to buy more machines for his sewing business.

loans.name: Musyene Thuyimanaye Group

texts.en:
Joseline is a thirty eight year old married woman with 10 children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

For 14 years now, she has been selling cassava flour in markets. She began the business so as to sustain her family despite the challenges of price flactuation and inadequate capital to meet the demand.

Her dreams are of educating her children up to the university level and having a food store.  Joseline intends to use the money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to pay for cassava flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas to re-sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha lives with her six children in her own house. She operates a food stall. She’s been in business for two years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for her to make the best dishes and beverages. She has a large clientele because people know that everything she makes is top quality at affordable prices with the best service. 

Mwanasha is very devoted to her work and what she most wants in life is to make her dreams reality. This is why she works so hard because she knows that’s the way to reach success. Demand has been increasing for some time now and she does not want to disappoint her customers so she’s decided to increase production but needs capital to invest in ingredients which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy corn and wheat flour, sugar, rice, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat flour, sugar, rice, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tires and an engine for his taxi van.

loans.name: Gs Paso De Vela Group

texts.es:
El señor Walter de 28 años de edad soltero, vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en la comunidad de paso de vela al sur de Honduras, su   actividad  es la venta de ropa nueva se dedica al negocio desde hace 2 años, sus ventas son  ambulante,  sus clientes son los todos los vecino de la comunidad.
Walter Solicita el préstamo por L. 5,000.00 para la compra de ropa nueva como trajes, camiseta, sandalias de baños, fragancias, blusas, pantalones y chores, así tener mejores ganancias, ya que los últimos meses del año es cuando mejoran más sus ventas.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo Walter desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeros de grupo quienes se dedican a la venta de tortillas,  y pulpería, ellas son Doña Hilda  y Soany residentes en la aldea paso de vela al sur de honduras. 
Walter su sueño es tener el negocio mas surtido y tener local propio y brindarles mejor atención a sus  clientes.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Walter, 28, is single living in his mother’s house located in the community of Paso de Vela in south Honduras.  His activity for the last two years has been selling new clothes from place to place; his customers are all his neighbors in the community.  Walter is asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy new clothes like suits, t-shirts, bath sandals, fragrances, blouses, pants and shorts to earn higher profits because his sales improve during the last months of the years.  With support from this loan, Walter wants to continue investing in his business and continue growing like his fellow group members who sell tortillas and groceries; they are Hilda and Soany who also live in the village of Paso de Vela in south Honduras.  Walter’s dream is to stock a wider selection and to have his own locale and to provide better customer service.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fragrances.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is twenty-six years old and married with two children. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for ten years now. His mixed farm produces maize, milk and beans, which are all sold locally. He is also employed as a taxi driver. 

Philip has made a loan request of 62,400 KES (Kenyan shillings) in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire more land that will enable him to expand his dairy farming. He faces the challenge of competition and a poor transport network that affects his income. He is optimistic that the proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to secure a good future for his kids.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Manuel Alonso

texts.es:
MANUEL ALONSO tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Venetanas Provincia de los ríos.
Manuel es ejecutivo de ventas, además se ddeica a mezcklar música en una discoteca. Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador y mezclador. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesarío para ganarce un dinero extra. Las compras lo hara en Guaranda.
El sueño es tener un local para ser el mezclador principal. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero. En el tiempo libre le gusta actualizar la música.
texts.en:
Manuel Alonso is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Manuel is a sales manager, but he is also in charge of sound mixing at a discotheque. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a computer and a sound mixer. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to earn extra money. These purchases will be made in Guaranda.

His dream is to have his own establishment where he is the primary mixer. The challenges he faces include the lack of money. In his free time, he enjoys updating pieces of music.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a sound mixer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Mrs. Uyanga is 37 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar City in Mongolia. Her husband works with her in her training course business. Her daughter Emujin, age nine, goes to primary school. 

Uyanga just started her business as a training course provider in August, 2012. She provides training courses to local business people in how to manage small and micro businesses. She is planning to promote her business, spread her message to business people in other districts and expand her business coverage. She is now requesting loan of 4,100,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car for business use. 

She is a friendly, welcoming, open-minded and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car for business use.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past nine years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells all types of flour, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Isaac is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to buy more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar, and soap.  The loan will help Isaac generate greater profits, pay school fees for his child,  and buy basic needs such as food. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale shop. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase commodities such as milk, bread, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu started a dumpling making business approximately a year ago, motivated mainly by the great economic difficulties that her household was facing. That was when she started her business - with very little capital but with great enthusiasm. 

Thanks to her making dumplings, her husband and their four children can have a better quality of life at home and although they still have difficulties, they have more of a chance of getting over them. In addition to this business, she also sells coconuts and groundnuts from the same locale. 

The greatest difficulty Saumu has in her business is her frying pan which is small and leaking. This makes her production much more expensive and also often delays her work. Hoping to overcome this difficulty Saumu is looking for a loan in order to buy a bigger frying pan, and some ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.

Her goal is to run a hotel some time.

loans.use: to buy a bigger frying pan, and some ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy course materials.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela es ama de casa y dueña de una papelería y combina estas actividades con la producción de café, pues su familia se ha dedicado por varias generaciones a esto. Normalmente ella contrata personal para que trabaje en sus fincas ya que no le queda mucho tiempo para realizar ella misma las labores en el campo, sin embargo está al pendiente de todo lo que allí hace falta. Para la siguiente cosecha Angela necesita comprar fertilizantes pues hace poco resembro parte de sus cafetales y con esto en un lapso de 3 años que estas nuevas plantas comiencen a dar frutos aumentará su producción. Angela vive con su esposo y su nieta y pasando la cosecha le gustaría arreglar una recamara extra que tiene en su casa para poder rentarla a estudiantes foráneos que vienen a su ciudad.
texts.en: Angela’s a housewife and owns a stationery shop; she combines these activities with growing coffee because her family has done this for generations.  Usually, she hires personnel to work her coffee crops because she doesn’t have much time left over to do the field work herself.  However, she’s always on top of everything needed there.  For the next harvest, Angela needs to buy fertilizer because she recently replanted part of the coffee grove and these plants will be ready to produce in three years and her yields will increase.  Angela lives with her husband and her granddaughter and after harvest would like to fix up an extra bedroom she has at home so she can rent it to foreign students who come to her city.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gs El Valle Group

texts.es:
La Señora Norma se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta ropa de varón, mujer edredones, ropa interior, ella cuenta con mas 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
Doña Norma es una persona muy trabajadora, ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona y a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela porque su manera de atenderlos es muy especial, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Norma comprara dos fardos de ropa de cama, ropa de niño, sandalias, lociones y cremas. Esto le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Doña Norma sueña con surtir su negocio y comprar otros estantes para exhibir mejor el producto.
Sonia Su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de verduras al por mayor desde hace 9 años.
Pedro Su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de cerdos y granos básicos, maíz y frijoles desde hace 5 años.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Norma’s a merchant; her main activity is selling men’s and women’s clothes, comforters, underwear.  She has more than five years’ experience running her business.  Norma’s a very hardworking person and has a local clientele.  She’s gotten ahead thanks to her business since it’s been one of her main sources of income.  She’s won over her customers thanks to the very special way she treats them.  With support from the requested loan, Norma will buy two bales of bed linens, children’s clothes, sandals, lotions and creams.  This will contribute to her having a better business to cover household expenses and have a better quality of life for her family.  Norma dreams with stocking her business and to buy more shelving to better display her wares.  

Sonia’s main source of income for the last nine years has come from her wholesale vegetable sales business and Pedro’s main source of income for the last five years has been from his business selling pigs and basic grains like corn and beans.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy two bales of bed linens, children's clothes, sandals, lotions and creams.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past five years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Isaac is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to purchase essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar, and soap.  This loan will help Isaac generate greater profits and pay for his family's medical expenses and food. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase commodities such as milk, bread, sugar ,and soap.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito, who is married with three kids and is 33 years old, resides at Pandanan, SND, Tukuran.

Julito operates a fishing business venture to earn a living and he has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Julito joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Julito wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Julio Dimas

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Juan no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su hermano mayor, Julio trabaja brindando servicios de soldadura, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, adicionalmente Julio brinda una pequeña camioneta, la cual utiliza pra brindar servicios de carga,él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento de su camioneta, de esta manera Juan podrá brindar servicios de transporte de carga, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio, 21, is single and lives in the city of Chiclayo with his parents and siblings.  He's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who has a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately Juan wasn't able to study cooking as he would have liked to do.  In his free time he likes to read a little, and sometimes he cooks a delicious duck and rice to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, and thanks to the support of his older brother, Julio works as a welder.  He works every day from early in the morning and can work for approximately 10 hours.  Julio also offers transportation services using his truck. He is comfortable doing his job and believes it's going well for him because of his kind treatment of his customers.

Julio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to refurbish and maintain his truck.  This way Juan will be able to offer cargo transportation service and continue working and making the effort to get ahead and realize his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to refurbish and maintain his truck

loans.name: Claudia Stefanny

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Claudia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para solventar sus gastos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace más de un año Claudia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende diversos platos de comida china, ella es muy buena cocina y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda en su negocio, Claudia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Claudia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su local de ventas, ya que ha aumentado su clientela y necesita ampliar su local, así también comprará algunas sillas y mesas para acondicionar su local, de esta manera ella seguirá trabajado y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su local propio y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young 20-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her small 3-year-old child in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial. She loves her child and he is her reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, uses all of her effort to get her family ahead. Unfortunately, Claudia was not able to study toward a professional career. Since she was very young she had to work to cover expenses, but she would have liked to have studied. 

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Claudia has worked in her little business for more than a year selling food. She sells a variety of Chinese dishes. She is a very good cook and has the help of her husband who helps with the business. Claudia works everyday, approximately 8 hours. She feels good doing her work and she believes that is going well die to her good seasoning and because she treats her customers well. 

Claudia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help offered she will be able to carry out improvements to her storefront windows. She has increased her clientele and she needs to expand her store front as well as buy chairs and tables to improve it. In this way she will continue to work with great effort in to be able to achieve her greatest dream which is to have her own storefront. In the not to distant future she hopes to be able to see her little one become a great professional.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to her storefront.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Progreso Unido” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; peluquería, feriantes, venta de empanadas, venta de pan amasado, costuras, venta de articulos para el hogar servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Estrella, integrante del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste de pantalón y polera de color café, encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño, lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida rápida, desde hace 9 años. Se desempeña atendiendo en su local de lunes a viernes desde las 11ºº hasta las 18ºº horas junto con la ayuda de su hija, ofreciendo a su clientela empanadas de queso, napolitana, camarón queso, completos, hamburguesas de pollo y carne, sándwich, bebidas y dulces en general.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados, panaderías, mercados, proveedores que le ofrecen productos de calidad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará pollo, salchichas, bebidas, pan, mayonesa, aceite, servilletas, jamón y queso.
Una de las metas de Estrella es poder comprar un conteiner donde pueda instalar su negocio, ya que el conteiner viene completo con piso, lavaplatos, muebles, para una buena atención a su clientela.
Estrella vive junto a su hija, quien la ayuda en las ventas de comida rápida y su nieta de 1 año de edad. Sus sueños son tener una buena salud, para seguir con su rubro y poder seguir con su rubro que tanto le gusta, atender a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fono Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “El Progreso Unido” (United Progress) and it has 18 entrepreneurs who carry out a variety of activities among which are barber shop, street market vendor, turnover sales, bread sales, sewing, home items sales and services, among others.  All are from the city of Valparaíso.

Estrella is a communal bank member and in the photo is seated in the first row, second from right to left, wearing brown pants and shirt with a black jacket; her hair is brows and she wears it loose.  She’s been selling fast-food for the last nine years.  She tends to her stand from Monday through Friday from 11am until 6pm with help from her daughter; she sells cheese turnovers, Napolitana turnovers [filled with ricotta and tomato], shrimp with cheese, full meals, chicken and meat hamburgers, sandwiches, soft-drinks and sweets in general.

She buys the merchandise and ingredients as needed in supermarkets, bakeries, markets and from suppliers that provide quality products at low prices which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy chicken, sausages, soft-drinks, bread, mayonnaise, oil, napkins, ham and cheese.  One of Estrella’s goals is to buy a container she can install in her business because it comes complete with floor, dishwasher and furniture to provide good customer service.

Estrella lives with her daughter who helps her sell fast-food and also lives with her one-year-old granddaughter.  Her dream is to be in good health to continue with her business where she so enjoys taking care of her customers.  She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her because it’s allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the company of her fellow entrepreneurs in the communal bank because they share different activities and interests which has been a way for her to enjoy herself for a time.  With respect to the training offered during the meetings, she’s learned how to better manage her business.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago.  It’s the regional capital and seat of the national legislative branch of government.  It’s the nation’s main port and it has a variety of beautiful, picturesque sites like for example Nobel Prize laureate Pablo Neruda’s house.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, soft-drinks, bread, mayonnaise, oil, napkins, ham and cheese.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es: Emmanuel es médico sin embargo desde pequeño ha aprendido todo lo relacionado con el café ya que su abuelo se dedicaba a esta actividad y le heredó algunos terrenos con cultivos de esta planta. Durante la cosecha pasada Emmanuel resembró parte de sus terrenos pues las plantas ya habían cumplido su ciclo de vida productiva y necesitaban ser cambiadas. Para la siguiente cosecha Emmanuel solicita un crédito ya que comprará abono y también utilizará parte de este dinero para realizar el pago a los cortadores de café que ha contratado. Después de la cosecha a él le gustaría invertir en equipo para su consultorio médico y tiene como meta a futuro seguirse preparando para ser un mejor profesionista ya que en la actualidad existe mucha competencia en el mundo laboral.
texts.en: Emmanuel is a physician but learned everything related to growing coffee since he was a little boy because his grandfather was in this business and he inherited some land that was used to grow coffee.  During the last harvest, Emmanuel replanted part of his land because the plants exhausted their productive cycles and needed to be replaced.  For next harvest, Emmanuel is requesting a loan because he’ll buy manure and will use part of the money to pay laborers he’s hired to pick the coffee.  After harvest, he’d like to invest in equipment for his medical office and his future goal is to continue training to become a better professional since there is much competition nowadays in the work place.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi is 47 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Nazmi used to work as painter. Now he is preparing to start his own planting business in a greenhouse. His wife works as a seller in a bakery. 

Nazmi is requesting his first loan, which he will use to buy materials for planting plums and for an irrigation system. His greenhouse is at a house in the village where he lives and this loan will help him start his business soon. He will sell the plums locally. His goal is to expand further. In the future, he hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for planting plums and for an irrigation system.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 44 years old and takes care of three relatives. He owns a business selling green bananas. He has four years of experience. His business is open every day each week from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. except for Saturday.

Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy green bananas to resell. Through this expansion, Pierre will be able to earn more profit, which will be used to expand his food market, save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more green bananas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: El deseo de salir adelante es enorme para ella, quien vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos menores, ella es muy trabajadora quien desde hace siete años que trabaja criando pollos y gallinas para posteriormente comercializarlos. La delincuencia es un problema muy grave que se vive actualmente en la zona en que reside, por lo que ella anhela salir adelante con su trabajo ignorando las malas influencias que la acechan en su entorno. Con el fin de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año en donde la venta de gallinas indias y de pollos aumentan, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de gallinas, así mismo de concentrado, el cual es el alimento que se les da a estos animales para que crezcan y engorden para venderlos a precios justos. Ella cuenta con muchos deseos de mejorar en su vida y de este modo contar con un mejor futuro y darles un excelente ejemplo a sus hermanos demostrándoles que lejos de la delincuencia existe una vida mejor.
texts.en:
The desire to get ahead is enormous for her; she lives with her mother and younger siblings.  She’s very hardworking and has been raising chicks and chickens for the last seven years to subsequently sell.  Crime is a very grave problem currently widespread in the zone where she lives which is why she hopes to get ahead by means of her work ignoring the bad influences that surround her.  

Aiming at taking advantage of end-of-year season when the sale of guinea hens and chickens increases, she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy larger numbers of chickens as well as feed she gives them so they’ll grow and fatten up to be sold at fair price.  She very much wants to improve her life to have a better future and set an excellent example for her siblings showing them that a better life exists away from delinquency.

loans.use: to buy guinea hens to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
With a loan of 50,000 KES, Rehema will be able to purchase second-hand clothing to sell door to door. She has been doing this business for over eight years.  Thanks to it, she has gained a lot of sales experience.

Rehema is married, and her husband is also a businessman. They have two children, both in primary school.

Rehema wants her business to expand and to sell more so that she will be able to provide quality of life to her family. Her dream is to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing to sell door to door.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn.  She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items like lotion, makeup, powder, undergarments, shoes, and other products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Analyn hopes to give her children a good and quality education, and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products like lotion, makeup, powder, undergarments, shoes and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SIGUIDIA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28  ans, et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à Lafiabougou un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  
DIATA, première de la droite vers la gauche fait le commerce de fruits  dans ce groupe de femmes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  des régimes de bananes, dix paniers de papayes, cinq oranges et deux paniers d’ignames  au grand marché de Médine à Sikasso.
Elle les revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group SIGUIDIA are essentially married women averaging 28 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Lafiabougou, a district in Sikasso City. The women are on their second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. 
 
DIATA, the first on the right in the photo, does commerce in fruit in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase some bananas, 10 baskets of papayas, 5 oranges, and 2 baskets of yams at the big market of Médine in Sikasso. She resells them for cash at the market and at home to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for day-to-day family expenses, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Desde hace varias generaciones la familia de Rafael se ha dedicado a la producción de café y a de ser de ser abogado también ha seguido la tradición de su familia. Actualmente Rafael produce alrededor de 10 toneladas anuales las cuales entrega a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” asociación a la cual pertenece desde ya hace varios años. Para la siguiente cosecha Rafael necesita un crédito para realizar el pago a los cortadores de café que ha contratado así como para pago de transporte de su café. Esté crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha. Con las ganancias que obtenga de esto a Rafael le gustaría realizar algunas modificaciones en su casa ya que tiene algunos detalles por componer.
texts.en:
Rafael’s family has been producing coffee for several generations. Even though he wanted to become a lawyer, Rafael also wished to continue the family tradition. He currently produces approximately 10 tons of coffee per year and delivers his harvested crop to “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, an association that he joined several years ago.

For the next harvest, Rafael needs a loan so that he can pay the coffee pickers that he has hired. In addition, he will pay the cost of transporting his coffee. The loan will be repaid at the end of the harvest. With the profits that he will earn, Rafael would like to make a few modifications to his house and complete a few details that need to be finished.

loans.use: to pay the wages of his coffee pickers and the cost of transporting the coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her karaoke machine.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  cooks  kenkey for sale at Abura.  She is single and has one child.

 Ama  has been selling kenkey for 15 years now.  She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills.  

Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase scissors and cosmetics products for barber shop business.

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.en:
Edelisa, age 41, is married and has four children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Edelisa operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair fishing boats.

Edelisa been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Edelisa wants to save money to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair fishing boats.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie, a 28-year-old married mother of a two-year-old, has operated her well-organized retail enterprise for one year now. Working from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. everyday, she employees one person to help her.

Epiphanie has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more avocados, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc. She will reinvest the profits arising from this loan in her business and pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more avocados, salt, soap, cooking oil. etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Fifty year old Stephen is a farmer from Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He is married with five children, four of whom are currently attending school. 

He has been in the farming business for 25 years now, and has two employees. His mixed farm produces milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. He also operates a power saw business in the same region. (Has a power saw which he hires out.) 

Stephen has made a loan request of 62,400 KES (Kenyan Shillings) through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him improve the livelihood of his family. His biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough animal feeds during the dry seasons.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zultsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Zultsetseg is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a ger (traditional housing) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

Her husband, Galbadrah, 30, works part-time in a private company as an assistant worker. Her two sons, Byambadorj and Batdorj,  ages 4 and 3, go to kindergarten, and her daughter, Battsetseg, 9 months old, stays home with Zultsetseg’s parents, who take care of the baby during the day. 

Zultsetseg has been working as a saleswoman in clothes, optical and grocery stores for years, and now she is planning to start her own business of clothes retail in the local market. Since their family now has two toddlers and one newborn, their family expenses have increased. She is asking for 1,000,000 MNT to import clothes for her newly starting clothes retail business in the local market. 

Zultsetseg is a communicative, friendly, and hardworking person.

loans.use: to import clothes for her newly starting clothes retail business in the local market.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Mlle Odette est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 33 ans célibataire sans enfant résidant dans un quartier bien connu de la ville de Doouala. Elle exerce le métier de coiffeuse depuis 03ans et son salon est situé dans la concession familiale. la cliente souhaite obtenir ce prêt afin de se ravitailler en produits de beauté et mèches. Et avec le bénéfice obtenu, elle a pour ambition de trouver un nouveau local ce qui permet de devenir totalement indépendante de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Odette is a young Cameroonian woman, 33 years old, unmarried, and without children living in a well-known district in Doouala City. She has been in the hairstyling trade for three years, and her salon is located in the family concession. 

This client would like to obtain this loan to stock up again with beauty products and hair extensions. With the profits obtained, she has the ambition to look for a new spot enabling her to become totally independent from her family.

loans.use: to purchase salon products to sell

loans.name: C5301 Kanguka Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 47 years old and has four children. He also takes care of two relatives. Evariste sells meat, which he has been doing for three years. His business is well organized. He works from 7 AM until 4 PM every day and employs two people. 

Evariste is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company, which he will use to purchase more meat to sell. With the profits, he plans to save money for his future and buy his own house. 

Evariste is the leader of the group which is called "C5301 KANGUKA" in the local language and is the first row on the right.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à BOUGOULA VILLE, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso.. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
ASSAN, 2 eme de la gauche vers la droite, fait l’achat vente  des fruits dans ce groupe de femmes BENKADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 paniers de régimes de bananes qu’elle revendra au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Sikasso ville et souvent au marché de Loulouni.
Elle revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKADI are married women averaging 38 years of age and three children each living for the most part in polygamous families in BOUGOULA VILLE, a district in Sikasso City. The women are on their ninth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were indeed paid back.
 
ASSAN, who is second from the left in the photo, buys and sells fruit in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 baskets of bananas that she will resell at the big market of Sikasso City. She gets her supplies from the villages surrounding Sikasso and often from the Loulouni market. She makes her sales retail and for cash to a customer base composed of men and women at the market and at home.
