She envisions making an average monthly profit of 55,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for paying the loan interest, and the other part is for her savings. Her ambition is to increase her sales, so as to do better in satisfying her ever-growing customer base.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29  ans, et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
FILY ,assise en mouchoir blanc, fait le commerce de  banane Plantain dans ce groupe de femmes SOUTOURA. Il ya environ 12 ans qu’elle mène cette activité et jouis d’une grande notoriété à la matière.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt:  une quarantaine de régimes de bananes plantains.Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Médine à Sikasso les jours de foire.
Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group SOUTOURA are essentially married women averaging 29 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a working-class district in Sikasso City. The women are on their 12th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. 
 
FILY, who is seated in the photo and wearing a white scarf, does commerce in plantains in this group of women. She has been in this business for about twelve years and enjoys great fame in this domain. She intends to use her loan to purchase: about 40 bunches of plantains. She gets her supplies from the big market of Médine in Sikasso on market days. She resells them for cash to a customer base composed of men and women at the big market of Sikasso City and at home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 42,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for paying the loan interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase plantains to sell

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 34 years old and is married with one child who is 5 years old. His business is well organized; he employees three people to help him. Theogene has four years of experience in this business and he works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. every day. 

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance Company, in order to expand his business by buying more spare parts to sell. With the profit from the loan, Theogene will reinvest in his business and pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is taking out a new loan to expand her vegetable selling business. She is happy that it has given her good results, which is why she has never regretted investing in it. 

Rukia used her previous loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for her business. She says that it had a commendable impact both on her business and her home. 

With this new investment, she is sure to have a good income to continue providing a good and quality life for her family. She is a determined woman who, despite being a widow, has been able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, dried shark and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua cooks banku and Ga kenkey for sale.  She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Abura. Ekua has been into this business for seven years now.  

Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku and kenkey for sale. 

She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku .

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku and kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children.  She is a fish monger in Abura, which she has been doing for eight years. Ekua buys fresh fish and smokes it to sell. 

Ekua is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase large quantities of fresh fish to smoke.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. With the new profits, Ekua hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and married with two children, aged three and six years old. She is a farmer from Kitale in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for six years now. Her mixed farm currently produces eggs and milk which she sells to the local market. She solely relies on her income from farming to cater to the needs of her family.

Nancy has made her second loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES in order to buy chickens. This loan will enable her to acquire additional chickens for her poultry farm which will increase her egg production and income. She plans to expand her poultry farm by acquiring at least 2,000 chickens and be the major supplier of eggs in the region. Her primary challenge in this business has been the shortage of feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
MAMADOU  est âgé de 36 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et ses époux dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
MAMADOU   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DANGASSA et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, SANANKOROBA
MAMADOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
MAMADOU is 36 years old and lives with his children and his wives in the sub-prefecture of KOUROUBA, Region of KOULIKORO. He did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of grains. 

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the second loan, he is on this third individual loan, which will be used to purchase 4 tonnes of grains (corn, beans, millet, fonio) from peasant producers in and around DANGASSA. He will keep the grains for at least two months. Basically he makes his sales in bulk to a customer base composed of retailers from the big cities, such as Bamako or SANANKOROBA.

MAMADOU hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan and reinvesting in business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married man and describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. Benard has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy charcoal to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 49 years old and widowed. She is a mother to her four children, three of whom are adults, while one is still in school. Fatuma struggles to see that her last born acquires a good education.

With the 20,000 KES, Fatuma will be able to buy more clothing and increase the inventory in her store. She basically sells khangas (wraps of traditional cloth), and has done this for two years. She wishes to increase her inventory in order to sell more and be able to save. 

She dreams of her business growing and allowing her, in time, to save enough to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 61 años, creció en una familia de escasos recursos económicos por lo que cuando acabó la primaria, ya se dedicó a ayudar a sus padres con duro y esforzado trabajo. Ahora está casado con Georgina de 72 años. Juntos han atravesado grandes obstáculos como la imposibilidad de tener hijos, ya que los tratamientos eran muy costosos. Sin embargo, han salido adelante y viven en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Aunque hay un alto índice de pobreza el espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes ha hecho que la  ciudad sobresalga. En el sector rural y urbano se puede encontrar familias destacando sus talentos para emprender con alguna idea que les pueda generar rentabilidad para conseguir el sustento diario. 
Víctor aprendió de sus padres  la actividad de elaborar bloques de cemento, y gracias a su espíritu emprendedor  ha llevado a cabo este trabajo desde hace 32 años. Trabaja todos los días entre 10 y 12horas y aun así la producción que realiza no abastece la demanda de sus clientes, principalmente porque la elaboración del producto toma mucho tiempo y cuidado. Víctor solicita un crédito a Fundación Alternativa para adquirir materiales y poder pagar a una persona que le ayude en la producción de tal forma que se oferte mayor cantidad de ladrillos y así atraer más clientes e incrementar sus ganancias las cuales utilizará para sustentar a su esposa y a él, un futuro estable, con salud,  y también para pagar algunas deudas de impuestos que están pendientes. Víctor agradece la intermediación de Kiva por ser parte de este paso de crecimiento en su vida laboral y familiar.
texts.en:
Victor, 61, grew up in a family of scarce economic resources so when he finished elementary school he started to help his parents working hard doing  heavy work.  Now, he’s married to Georgina, 72, and they’ve gone through obstacles together like the inability to have children since treatments were very costly.  However, they’ve gotten ahead and live in Latacunga, capital of Cotopaxi Province, one of the provinces that make up the Sierra Region of Ecuador and that in recent years has developed significantly  and is now considered one of the region’s most important thanks to the flower growing industry, mining, metallurgy, agroindustry, agriculture and animal husbandry.  In addition, there are businesses established here that generate important income transforming it into a commercial city with several opportunities for getting ahead.  Although there’s a high poverty index, the enterprising spirit of its residents has made the city stand out.  Families can be found both in the rural and urban sectors that stand out because of their skills in taking off with an idea that can generate profits for them in order to obtain daily sustenance.

Victor learned from his parents how to manufacture concrete blocks and thanks to his enterprising spirit has been doing this work for the last 32 years.  He works every day for between 10 and 12 hours and even this is not enough to meet customer demand mainly because production is time consuming and requires much care.  

Victor is asking Fundación Alternativa for a loan to buy materials and to pay a person to help him with production so that he can offer a larger number of bricks and attract more customers and increase his profits that he’ll use to support him and his wife for a stable future with good health and also to pay some pending tax debts.  Victor is thankful for Kiva’s involvement in being part of this step towards growth both in his work and in his family life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and to hire someone to help him with production.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fish monger in Abura. She buys fresh fish to smoke and fry it for sale.  Ama has been in this business for 10 years now.  She is married to a fisherman and has one child. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills.  She will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. 

With the new profit Ama wishes to expand her business

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a fishmonger at Abura. She buys fresh fish and fries it for sale. Efua has been into this business for five years now. 

She is married and has four children. Efua uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills.  

She will use her loan to purchase large quantities of fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profit, Efua wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a widow who is 45 years old and a mother of three children. She sells clothes in the Narok area and has been running the business for seven years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed her first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more clothing and put up a stall for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her dreams are to improve her living standards and own a residential plot

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and to set up a clothing stall

loans.name: Amima

texts.en: Amima is a petty trader. She operates a grocery shop. The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She has been doing this for two years now   Amima is married with two children. She uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their home  Amima needs this loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, Amima wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 47-year-old married woman. She has three children between 10 and 24 years old. She describes herself to be a God-fearing woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located near estates and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the renovation of her cow shed. Her business goal is to run a ranch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses, which will increase her business income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her cow shed

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a very devoted woman who very much loves her work and has the urge to move forward. She has had a food stall for several years, which she is still into. She is thankful for the previous loan, which enabled her to increase production. 

Mwanamisi wants to make new investments, and she does not have enough funds to do so. For this reason, she is requesting another loan in the amount of KES 25,000 to buy more ingredients such as basic grains, sugar, cooking fat, meat, etc. 

Mwanamisi has a good repayment history, and she is sure that she will repay her loan just as she did with the previous loan, which will make her stand a better chance to be entrusted with more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as basic grains, sugar, cooking fat, meat, etc.

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en: Nana Ama is a baker. She bakes meat pies and popcorn for sale at Abura. She is married to a driver and has two children. Nana has been baking for eight years now. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. With her profits, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new cycles and spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing and embriodery business

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe TERIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Lafiabougou un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  
ABY, première personne de la droite vers la gauche, fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires et des tissus dans ce groupe de femmes TERIYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  deux rouleaux de tissus pour femmes et hommes au Burkina Faso
Elle les revend au marché de LAFIABOUGOU et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the TERIYA group are married women who are 43 years old on average, and have an average of 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.

They are on their fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Aby, the first person from the right towards the left, sells food condiments and fabric in this TERIYA women's group. With this loan she plans to buy two rolls of fabric for men and women in Burkina Faso. She resells it at the market of Lafiabougou and in her family to a clientèle consisting of men and women, for cash. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,000 FCFA of which part is used for daily family expenses and the other is saved.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 61-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a blacksmith shop together with her husband for more than five years now. This is one of their sources of income. Her husband also works as a mechanic. 

Herminia is asking for a loan to buy metal and flat bars and other materials for their shop. With this they will be able to improve their living and income.

loans.use: buy materials for their metal shop

loans.name: Trust And Pay I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Trust and Pay I” group. They are small-scale business people based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata.  Fatmata is 40 years old.  She was born in Makeni city in Northern Sierra Leone.  Today, she is residing in Kenema together with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For many years now, Fatmata has been selling market food – onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, rice, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy food items to resell

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika is an Egyptian grandmother of a nine-year-old granddaughter, Lisa, whom she raises all on her own.  Donika’s son, who is the child’s father, struggled financially and ended his life in a very tragic way. Then little Lisa was placed under the custody of Donika. They both live in a village in southern Albania.

Donika did the seamstress job for a very long time and operated from her own home, but after she got the custody of her granddaughter, she stopped it because she had to look after Lisa.  Now, Donika is requesting a loan to cover medical expenses and she is almost begging lenders to help by financing her.

loans.use: cover medical expenses

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is from a small village in the Vani district. She is 40 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband and two children (23 and 14 years old).  Her younger son goes to the local school. The main source of income for the family is the small monthly salaries of Nato’s husband and her elder son. Her husband works as a cook and her son is an artisan.  Nato runs a small agricultural business. In particular, she has two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. The family sells hens as well and piglets seasonally.  

Nato has requested loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers.  Her loan request with Credo was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo.  This start-up loan program envisages provisioning credits with soft conditions for business start-up and re-startup to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Nato will purchase clothes in Tbilisi for wholesale prices and resell them in her village for a profit. It will be hard work for Nato, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of her family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the clothing trading business to increase her stocks and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions, and Nato will be able to finance the education of her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Prisila

texts.en:
Prisila, 50, is in a common-law marriage and has 8 children. She lives in a community in the town of Msambweni.

Seven years ago, Prisila decided to start up a business selling fruits with the goal of earning income to support the household expenses.  At this time, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES. She's planning to use the loan to invest in fruit such as oranges, papayas, watermelons, and mangoes, etc.

With this loan, Prisila is hoping to increase her sales and thereby improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 30 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a tailor in Bomet area and has been running the business for the past four years,  making a monthly income of KES 20,000

Jared has borrowed his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase a new sewing machine. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost the business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo is married to a kind man by the name of Ilhom and has 6 children.  Her husband is a driver and his income is not enough to provide the family with all necessary things. Dilrabo decided to start a new business in farming in order to generate  income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.  She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ by an organization for women and got enough skills about business.  Her children will help her with the business. She will be very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

Dilrabo is asking for a loan of 4000 Somonis to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to start her new farming business. She will get through using the loan and her business will be another source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has always been known as a hardworking person who has gotten her family ahead with a lot of effort. Despite not having had a chance to go to school, she has worked at different things, always leaving a good impression because of her commitment. 

Lydia is taking out a new loan to expand her clothes selling business. Thanks to having good sales and growth, Lydia is seeking a loan to buy more clothing and stock for her business to respond to her customers' orders.  She says that her previous loan was of great help since she was able to have ready stock to sell.

Lydia hopes to make more and more income to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Jessie Faviola

texts.es: La Sra. Jessie tiene 32 años y tiene 1 hijos  de la edad de 5 años, ella vive en la zona de Tembladerani,  la Sra. Jessie se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jessie va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de panetones y roscas de navidad para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de navidad y estos productos son muy requeridos por sus clientes y también para la compra de abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Jessie va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Jessie es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada con la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Jessie’s 32-years-old and has a 5-year-old son; she lives in the Tembladerani zone.  She works selling a variety of staple items in her grocery store located in the same neighborhood where she lives.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Jessie will use it to buy a variety of Christmas panettones and Christmas ring cakes to stock the store because the Christmas season is approaching and these products will be in high customer demand; she will also buy grocery items and soft-drinks to provide a variety of goods to her customers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Jessie will use profits to continue buying products and improving her income this way.  Her business wish is to have a warehouse to provide better customer service.  Jessie’s a very hardworking woman who feels happy about the opportunity granting the loan provides her with.

loans.use: to buy Christams panettones.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke, a 30-year-old married father of three children, two of whom are currently in school, lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past 15 years, Luke has been working hard to manage his small workshop business which makes beds, chairs and tables.

To help expand his business, Luke has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more materials to make wooden beds. This will help him to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. He hopes to become a big and well-known local businessman in town in the future.

Luke is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Luke who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make wooden beds.

loans.name: Benancio

texts.es:
Benancio de 33 años tiene por compañera a Beatriz de 30 años, complementan su alegría familiar sus 3 menores hijos Edgar, Ruth y María. Comparte sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda hecha a base de madera que logró adquirir desde muy joven con ayuda de sus padres.
Por herencia de sus abuelos recibió unas parcelas con las que gracias a ella lo amplio con la compra de algunos terrenos colindantes sumando así 6 años de experiencia en el rubro, existe una gran cantidad de árboles de cacao debido a que la zona es muy apropiada para la producción de cacao orgánico de calidad  y porque es una actividad ancestral de su familia.
Para una apropiada labor en el campo generalmente cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes son personas muy confiables de la zona, pues finalizando las tareas pendientes en un menor periodo posible aportan en brindarle un eficiente mantenimiento uniforme que se ve reflejado en la cosecha final.
Dentro de sus planes para la próxima campaña de cacao requiere contar con personal externo para el mantenimiento de sus árboles pues como es de saberse las plantaciones de cacao requieren 3 deshierbes de maleza por campaña, siendo el primero de ellos el mas arduo y detallado, adicional a ello desea contar con abono orgánico y herramientas menores para facilitar el trabajo pendiente.
Como meta a futuro desea convertirse en un mini acopiador de productos agrícolas puesto que tiene referentes de acopiadores mayores que desean trabajar con el a futuro esperando así dar un paso adelante en el desarrollo de su economía familiar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP , pues gracias a ello tiene todo lo necesario para invertir en su actividad agrícola con total fluidez, comparte su motivación con sus compañeros de su banco comunal a quienes agradece por ser un grupo muy responsable y con abundante compañerismo.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles podrá contratar jornaleros para el primer deshierbo de campaña de sus árboles de cacao, con el dinero restante comprará sacos de abono orgánico consistente en guano de ave.
texts.en:
Benanacio is 33 years old and lives with his companion Beatriz, age 30. Their cheerful family includes three young children: Edgar, Ruth, and María. Benancio and his family share a home made of wood, which he acquired at a very young age with the help of his parents.

He inherited a few plots of land from his grandparents, but he was able to expand his acreage by purchasing some additional plots that adjoined that property. Benancio has six years of experience in this line of work. He has several cacao trees since this area is well-suited for producing organic crops that are of high quality. In addition, farming is an activity that has been practiced by his family for many generations.

In order for the work to be done correctly, Benancio needs the help of workers who are reliable people from the area. They will be able to complete the outstanding tasks in a shorter period of time. This type of uniform and efficient maintenance is reflected in the final harvest.

For the next growing season, Benancio plans to hire outside help to maintain his cacao trees. He knows that cacao groves require weed removal three times throughout the season. The first removal is usually the most difficult and detailed. In addition, he wants to have organic compost and small tools available so that the outstanding work can be completed.

His goal for the future is to convert his business into a small-scale collection center of agricultural products. Benancio hopes that the large-scale distributors will want to work with him in the future, which will create an opportunity for him to improve his family’s financial condition. This is the second time he has requested a loan from MFP. Thanks to this loan, he will have everything he needs to invest in his farming business so that it will run smoothly. Benancio and his fellow Communal Bank members share the same motivation, so he is grateful to be part of a group that is responsible and demonstrates great camaraderie.

With this loan of 1,500 PEN, Benancio will hire workers for the first round of weed removal from his cacao grove. Any remaining funds will be used to buy sacks of organic compost, including bird droppings.

loans.use: to hire workers and to buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan tiene 53 años, cursó la escuela primaria está casado con Carmen de 51 años, tienen dos hijos de 14 y 11 años, viven en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador. En los últimos años Latacunga se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. En esta ciudad muchas de las fiestas conservan un profundo arraigo y pureza muy cercanos a los orígenes históricos o de la tradición ancestral. En cada fiesta la comida típica, los bailes y las presentaciones artísticas son el centro de atención de todos los habitantes y turistas. Hornado, cuyes, chugchucaras, etc, son algunos de los platos que se sirven al pasar por esta ciudad.
Juan se dedica a la crianza de animales para su posterior venta, desde hace un año. Fue un reto bastante grande para él y su familia comenzar con algo nuevo, pero la experiencia que sus vecinos y amigos le impartieron, le dieron la seguridad de seguir adelante y ha desempeñado un trabajo excelente a pesar de haberse dedicado mucho tiempo a la elaboración de bloques, pero el poco espacio que tenía en su casa no le permitieron continuar, es por eso que ahora en su tiempo libre ayuda a las bloqueras de los sectores aledaños. Ahora la crianza de animales se ha convertido en su principal fuente de trabajo a la cual le dedica entre seis y ocho horas al día y en donde además recibe ayuda de su esposa, juntos trabajan inclusive las madrugadas para atender a los animales y cuidar su salud para que sean más demandados en el mercado. Juan está preparado para dar el siguiente paso en el crecimiento de su negocio, por lo que ahora requiere comprar más animales y así obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para realizar esta meta Juan ha solicitado a Fundación Alternativa un préstamo con el cual pueda hacer esta compra y además aprovechar la oportunidad de capacitarse para llevar una correcta administración de su negocio y los recursos que en el están invertidos.
texts.en:
Juan, 53, attended elementary school.  He’s married to Carmen, 51, and they have two children who are 14 and 11 years old.  They live in Latacunga, capital of Cotopaxi Province one of the provinces that make up Ecuador’s Sierra Region.  Latacunga has developed significantly in recent years to such an extent that it’s considered to be one of the most important in the region thanks to its flower industry, mining, metallurgy, agroindustry, agriculture and animal husbandry.  Businesses that generate interesting income are also established here converting the city into a commercial center with several growth opportunities.  Many festivals occur in this city preserving the roots and purity of historical origins and ancestral traditions.  At every festival, traditional food, dances and artistic presentations are the center of attention for all inhabitants and tourists.  Some of the dishes that are served in this city are ‘hornado’ [roasted pig], guinea pigs, ‘chugchucaras’ [fried pork, 'mote'-boiled hominy, potatoes, fried plantains, turnovers, popcorn, and pork rinds; it is accompanied by aji, a spicy sauce made with hot peppers, tomatoes, cilantro, and onions], etc.

Juan has worked for a year raising animals for subsequent sale.  It was quite a challenge for him and his family to start something new but the experience his friends and neighbors shared with him helped him to feel confident about continuing forward and he’s done excellent work despite having worked for a long time manufacturing concrete blocks.  The little space he had available at home, however, made it impossible for him to continue with this so now he uses his free time to help out in nearby block factories.

Raising animals has now become his main source of employment and he spends between six and eight hours daily at it; his wife helps him and they work together even at dawn to tend to their animals and care for their health so that they will be in higher market demand.  Juan is prepared to take the next step for his business’ growth so wants to buy more animals to earn higher income that will help him improve his and his family’s quality of life.  To reach this goal, Juan has asked Fundación Alternativa for a loan he can use to make this purchase and also to obtain the training he needs to correctly manage his business and the resources that are being invested in it.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco, tiene 47 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. don Marco, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente solo vendía y reparaba relojes y artículos plásticos. Hace 10 años consiguió un puesto en un mercado local donde vende verduras y frutas como tomate, chile, repollo, papas, cebolla, habichuela, uvas y manzanas y también vende películas en CD y DVD y reparación de relojes. Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio. ha invertido 7 préstamos a su negocio con este actual que es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar CD, películas, verduras, uvas y manzanas para esta temporada navideña, con el objetivo de incrementar el volumen de ventas y los ingresos. Su plan es separar el negocio de verduras  para que lo administre su esposa y el de CD y películas y relojería lo administrara él.
texts.en: Marco, 47, is married and has two children; he lives in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua.  Marco has always been a merchant.  He used to just sell and repair watches and sell plastic items.  Ten years ago he acquired a stand at a local market where he sells vegetable and fruit like tomatoes, chilies, cabbage, potatoes, onions, beans, grapes and apples; he also sells movies on CDs and DVDs and repairs watches.  His wife helps him with the business.  He’s invested 7 loans into the business counting this current 12,000 Lempira loan that he’ll use to buy CDs, movies, vegetables, grapes and apples for the Christmas season aiming at increasing sales volume and income.  His plan is to separate the vegetable business for his wife to run and he’ll run the CD, movies and watch repair business himself.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grapes, apples, CDs and movies to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where he lives with his three children who are all schooling. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 10 years, producing milk, maize, tea, and pork, which he sells at the market in his local area.

Joseph is requesting a 30,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan from Juhudi kilimo to purchase pigs. He will sell the pork and earn extra income that will assist him in improving his livelihood and paying for his childrens' educations. He aspires to be the leading supplier of pork in his region. High costs of feeds is his major challenge in farming.

Joseph is grateful with the way Juhudi kilimo is processing loans.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 61 años, es un hombre amable y soñador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Nora, quien es su socio y también  trabaja en un restauran  como cocinera. Tienen un hijo de 8 años quien esta en la escuela y piensan darle una buena calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Alberto consiste en la venta de abarrotes en general como  arroz, azúcar, harina, leche, huevos, etc. Realiza esta actividad  económica en un local en el interior de su vivienda propia. Lleva 4 años en este trabajo y sus clientes han aumentado favorablemente. Se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de  mantener a su familia y también porque no  puede hacer trabajos forzados ya que tuvo un accidente en su empleo anterior.  Cada mañana junto a su conviviente van al mercado y realizan sus compras para tener los productos necesarios para la buena atención a sus clientes. Comenta que su negocio es rentable porque tiene muchos clientes, también esta en un lugar accesible y la ganancia que obtiene cada vez se incrementa. Antes de iniciar esta actividad tenía problemas económicos, no tenía el capital suficiente para realizar un negocio, pero obtuvo un préstamo y decidió abrir el negocio que actualmente tiene. Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio, salir a adelante e incrementar sus ventas. Por tanto éste será su prestamos número 4 con la institución MFP, espera seguir  siendo un socio  puntual. Además  el grupo que conforma son responsable y se apoyan mutuamente. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo utilizará para comprar  en mayor volumen para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, entre otros. ya que si su negocio cuenta con productos variables tendrá mayor  cantidad de clientes e incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alberto is 61 years old, a friendly man and a dreamer.  He lives in his own home alongside his wife, Nora.  Nora is his business partner and also works as a cook in a restaurant.  They have one 8-year old son, who goes to school.  They intend to give him a decent quality of life. 
Alberto's work is selling general grocery items, like rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs etc.  His store is located in his home.  He has been in this work for four years and has had a favorable increase in customers.  Alberto started this business because he needed a way to support his family and is unable to do heavy work due to an accident at his previous job.  Every morning Alberto and his wife go to the market.  They purchase the items they will need in order to offer their customers quality service.  Alberto says that his business is profitable because he has a lot of customers.  He is also in an accessible area, and his earnings are always increasing.  Before starting his business, Alberto had financial problems- he didn't have enough capital to open a business.  But he got a loan and decided to start the business that he currently runs.  He hopes to keep his store going, to get ahead, and to increase his sales.  This will be his fourth loan with MFP.  He plans to continue being a reliable member of his communal bank.   In addition, the members of his communal bank are responsible and offer each other mutual support.  With the requested sum of 1000 soles (USD $400), Alberto will purchase larger quantities of merchandise to stock up his store, like rice, sugar, eggs and other items.  If his store offers a variety of products, he will have a greater number of customers, which will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of rice, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia de 63 años, esta casada con Ezequiel de 57 años. Tiene la satisfacción de tener hoy a sus 4 hijos ya mayores, que son personas independientes. Posee una vivienda hecha a base de adobe que perdura a través del tiempo. Como toda madre luchadora desarrolló junto a Ezequiel la actividad productiva de cacao y café siendo este un gran sustento que ayudo a mantener su hogar desde hace 40 años. Las parcelas en donde siempre laboró hoy son alquiladas por otros agricultores debido a que es consiente que las energías aplicadas desde siempre ya no son las mismas y por ende ha pensado en cambiar de rubro.
Dentro de sus posibilidades planea realizar la venta de platos de pollada los fines de semana por considerar una actividad de menos esfuerzo y contando que es una persona muy amigable y conocida de su zona, esperando así en adelante seguir generando ingresos para apoyar a uno de sus menores hijos en los gastos que requieren sus estudios superiores. Por tanto solicitará 500 soles para comprar utensilios e insumos para iniciarse en el negocio de la venta de platos de pollada en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 63, is married to Ezequiel, 57.  She's satisfied that her four children are grown and independent.  She has a house made of adobe, which endures over time.

Like any dedicated mother, she worked with Ezequiel producing cacao and coffee, this being a big help in supporting her household for 40 years.  The plots of land where she always worked are rented to other farmers now because she's aware that the energy she always applied is no longer the same, and she has thought about changing jobs.

Among her possibilities is selling chicken dishes on the weekend.  She considers this a job that requires less effort; also, she's a friendly person who's well known in her area.

She hopes to continue generating income to pay the expenses for one of her younger children's advanced studies.  She'll request 500 soles [PEN] to buy utensils and supplies to get started in her business selling chicken dishes in her community.

loans.use: to buy chickens, condiments, and disposable plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: La señora Adelia sigue con su misma actividad que es la venta de varios productos de primera necesidad  en una tienda de barrio que tiene hace ya mucho tiempo,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la compra de material de construcción para remodelar (acabado de obra fina) su departamento en la casa de sus suegros, ahora solicita el credito para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, fideo, y tambien para la compra de variedad de productos como dulces y refrescos y panetones para esta epoca de fin de año ya que se incrementa su venta y es donde genera mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Adelia continues with her same job selling various staple items in a neighborhood store she has had for a long time.  She says the previous loan went well for her.  She used it to buy construction materials to remodel, putting the finishing touches on her apartment in her in-laws' house.

Now she's requesting a loan to buy groceries such as rice and noodles, and also to buy a variety of products such as candy, soda, and panettone because her sales increase in this end-of-the-year season and she generates more income.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 47 años, es una mujer  muy alegre y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente segundo quien se dedica a servicios múltiples,como ser obrero en construcción y taxista, etc. crían a sus 3 hijos de 15, 6 y 3 años quienes están estudiando. El trabajo de Martha  consiste en la venta de comida como pollo frito, hamburguesas, arroz chaufa,  guiso de pollo, etc. realiza esta actividad en el frontis de su casa propia. Cada día al atardecer saca sus utensilios como mesas, sillas, platos, cucharas, etc. Se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y también tener un empleo  con el cual pueda ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Junto a su conviviente realizan las compras cada día muy temprano, su hijo mayor la ayuda en la preparación de las distintas viandas. Considera rentable su negocio porque tiene buena sazón, sus clientes cada día se incrementan y sus ganancias hacienden  a un  50% de lo invertido. Antes de empezar su actividad  tenía problemas económicos, por no tener un empleo  estable. Por eso decidió  poner su negocio propio.  En el futuro espera poder construir un local en el interior de su vivienda, poner un restauran y generar mas ganancias económicas. Por tanto solicita 1,000 mil soles, lo utilizará para la compra de los ingredientes como arroz, huevos, condimentos, panes, papa,  etc. para preparar los distintos platos de comida. Se encuentra muy feliz  por contar con un respaldo económico para su negocio.
texts.en: Martha is 47 years old, a happy woman and a dreamer.  She lives in her own home together with her second husband, who makes his living in multiple areas.  He is a construction worker and a taxi driver, etc.  They are raising their three children, who are 15, 6 and 3 years old.  All three go to school.  Martha's work is preparing and selling food, like fried chicken, hamburgers, fried rice, chicken stew etc.  She runs her business in front of her house.  Each day, at dusk, she takes out her utensils, like tables, chairs, plates, spoons, etc.  She started her business because she needed a way to support her children's education and also to have a job to help with the household expenses.  Martha and her husband do the shopping together very early every morning.  Her oldest son helps her to prepare the different food.  She thinks that her business is profitable because of the good flavor of her dishes.  She has more customers every day and her earnings reach 50% of what she invests.  Prior to starting her business, Martha had financial problems because she didn't have a steady job, which is why she decided to start her own business.  In the future, she hopes to build a restaurant in her home, to make a better living.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 mil soles (USD $400), which she will use to purchase ingredients like rice, eggs, condiments, bread, potatoes, etc. to prepare different plates of food.  Martha is very happy to have financial backing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, eggs, condiments, bread and potatoes.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe FAÏDA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM assise  1ère  à droite sur la photo fait la vente de pagnes wax et real dans ce groupe de femmes FAÏDA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt six pièces de pagnes wax et réal. Elle s’approvisionne en Côte d’Ivoire auprès des grossistes et souvent au grand marché de la ville, les jours de foire.
Elle  vend au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant  en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.750 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group FAÏDA are married women averaging 37 years of age and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in NOUMOUSSO, a working-class district in Kadiolo City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were correctly paid back.
 
MARIAM, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, sells Wax and Real 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She gets her supplies from Cote d'Ivoire from wholesalers and often from the big market in town on market days. She sells them retail for cash to a customer base composed of men and women at the market and at home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 32,750 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for repaying the loan and the interest on it, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa)

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SINDIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygamies à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
DJENEBA assise  1ère  à gauche sur la photo fait la vente de condiments  et des pagnes wax et real dans ce groupe de femmes SINDIYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, cinq emballages de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne souvent dans les villages avoisinants Kadiolo ville  et chez les grossistes au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso les jours de foire.
Elle les revend au marché  de Kadiolo ville et en famille à une clientèle mixte au comptant, à crédit et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.750FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group SINDIYA are married women averaging 37 years of age and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in NOUMOUSSO, a working-class district in Kadiolo City. They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were correctly paid back.
 
DJENEBA, who is sitting first from the left in the photo, buys and sells condiments, as well as Wax and Real 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 packs of condiments. She gets her supplies from the villages neighboring Kadiolo City and from wholesalers at the big market of Sikasso City on market days. Accepting cash and credit, she sells them retail to a mixed customer base at the Kadiolo City market and at home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,750 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for repaying the loan and the interest on it, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Emardin

texts.en:
Emardin is a very responsible, hardworking person who would like to improve her quality of life and that of her family in order to triumph in life. She is 46 years old, is widowed, and lives with her six children in the rural area of Samburu, Kinango district.

Emardin works along with her children in agriculture. They grow a variety of crops like sugarcane, bananas, and vegetables, and also keep livestock.  They also need to invest in the purchase of seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers.

She dreams of having a ready market for her produce and of improving the quality of life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 47-year-old farmer from Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years, producing tea, peas, milk, beans and maize, which he sells at the local market in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. The proceeds from the products he will sell will be used to improve his poultry business and his livelihood. He aspires to buy another one-acre piece of land in the next five years.

The high cost of feed and the poor market for his products are his main challenges in farming.

Silas is happy with the way Juhudi Kilimo is processing loans.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 36 years old and lives with her seven children and husband. She sells dried fish in the town market. She has had this business for many years and has a lot of sales experience. She has acquired a lot of customers because she always has what people are looking for and she offers the best quality products at low prices. 

Sophia is a hard-working woman who strives to get ahead. She wants to succeed in the short-term, which gives her a lot of motivation and strength in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks of dried fish to sell. She is a responsible person with a spotless moral character, and she is sure that she will be able to successfully repay the loan. She hopes to provide economic security for her household.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en:
Elgiz is 28 years old. He is a single person. Egiz lives in the Fizuli region with his family, but he was an IDP (internally displaced person) person from Fizuli city. 

Now he needs 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new wheels and other spare parts for his car. He loves his work. Elgiz has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He wants to increase his monthly income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre agricultor de 40 años de edad, el esta soltero y vive en Sololá. 
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa, cebolla, zanahoria y ejote, en unas parcelas que presta con otras personas a pocos kilómetros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre pero antes de realizar su propio cultivo el trabajo con personas ajenas donde perfecciono y obtuvo mas experiencia en este trabajo.
El ahora cuenta con 15 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que tendría  mejores ganancias, de este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 4,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas  de papa y su fertilizante para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida de su familia.
Con sus ganancias el sueña la compra de una parcela y expandir su cultivo,  también construir una mejor  vivienda para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer.  He is 40 years old, single and lives in Sololá. 
Juan makes his living growing potatoes, onions, carrots and green beans on a plot of land that he rents with other farmers.  It is located a few kilometers from his home.  Juan learned to farm from his father, but before growing his own crop, he worked with others.  That helped him to perfect his work and to gain more experience farming. 
Juan has now been growing his own crops for fifteen years.  He saw that he would have a getter income working on his own.  He is requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 (USD $525) so that he can purchase potato seed and fertilizer to later plant and harvest.  This will improve his income and his family's quality of life. 
With his earnings, Juan dreams of purchasing a plot of land and expanding his plantings.  He also wants to build a better dwelling for his family.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Nahason

texts.en:
Nahason is aged thirty-eight and is a farmer in Nyamira county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children, who are all in school. He has been in farming for the past seventeen years, producing milk and vegetables. He sells second-hand clothes as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a dairy cow, which will give him more milk and more income. This will enable him to uplift his livelihood and pay for his children's school fees. 

He aspires to buy two more dairy cows in the next five years.

High transport costs, pests, and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

Nahason is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
This young woman is starting a business of selling clothing (khangas). She wants to have a new start and to be more responsible, which is one of the best and biggest decisions that she has made. Her family is ready to give her support. She currently sells fried fish, a business she has run for the last three years. 

Mlongo is an active woman. She is enterprising, dedicated to her work, and a fighter with many goals that she wants to achieve. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and is very happy with the business. 

Mlongo anticipates a good return on this investment because she wants to take advantage of the approaching December festive season. She plans to sell door-to-door in the neighborhood. However, she does not plan to quit her fish selling business since she mostly sells during the afternoon hours. 

With the loan, Mlongo will buy bales of khangas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bales of khangas to sell.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya lives in Gyumri town with her family. She is a teacher and works at local school. Her daughter, Sona, studies at the Armenian State Economic University in the faculty of Public Finance.

It is very difficult for Valya to sustain the family of five. Valya's salary allows her to cover family's basic costs, but is not enough to save for Sona's education. 

With the requested amount, Valya will pay for her daughter’s annual tuition fee and will be able to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's annual tuition fee.

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Khir. It consists of 6 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Eyman is 23 years old. She is a single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She owns a house and she applied for a youth loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy water tank for her house.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ro purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana es madre y abuela, mujer muy trabajadora, a pesar de sus 52 años se siente llena de vida y a la vez orgullosa de ver hoy a sus hijos ya mayores e independientes forjándose un buen porvenir, posee una vivienda de material noble que logró construir de a pocos. Dejando de lado las actividades agropecuarias que desempeñó hasta hace un tiempo busco una alternativa de negocio como es la venta de pescado y verduras al por mayor. Viene desempeñándose como tal desde hace 1 año en la cual le han servido para conocer a sus nuevos clientes  quienes ahora son sus amigos. Se desplaza sola con ayuda de transportistas que recorren dichas rutas llevando sus productos para su expendio preferentemente los fines de semana.
Le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que debe madrugar muchas veces y recorrer diversos puntos de su localidad llegando a contactarse con muchas personas quienes valoran mucho su trabajo y llegan a entablar una buena amistad con ella no obstante es necesario aclarar que termina el día muy agotada después de retornar a su domicilio en donde almacena sus productos.
Al cumplir exactamente un año en su labor tiene planeado expandir la compra de su mercadería para abastecer a mas anexos para el cual desea mayor capital logrando así concretar uno de sus objetivos que es el de llegar a todos los puntos de su localidad. Este viene a ser su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad brindada así como comprometida con el pago responsable de sus cuotas. Espera mantener la armonía y motivación que halló desde el momento en que ingreso a su grupo comunal ya que lo considera una gran equipo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la compra de mercadería consistente en pescado congelado y verduras de primera necesidad muy solicitados por sus clientes minoristas.
texts.en:
Marciana is a mother and a grandmother; she’s a very hardworking woman.  Despite her age of 52, she is full of life and proud to see her children now productive, independent adults who are forging good futures.  She owns a house built of substantial materials that she managed to build little by little.  Up until a short time ago, she worked in agriculture and animal husbandry but then looked for a business alternative like the sale of fish and vegetables at wholesale.  She’s been doing this for a year and she’s met new customers who are now her friends.  She heads out by herself with help from transportation providers who cover her routes taking her products preferably on the weekend.

She likes her activity very much because she must rise at dawn often and cover several points in her location contacting many people who value her work very much and establish good friendships with her; it must be clear, however, that she ends her day exhausted after returning home where she stores her goods.

At the exact first year anniversary of her business, she plans to buy merchandise to supply more annexes and needs more capital to do so since one of her goals it to reach all the points in her location.  This will be her first MFP loan and she feels very happy with the opportunity being provided and is committed make her payments responsibly.  She hopes to retain the harmony and motivation she found since first becoming part of her communal bank; she considers it to be a great team.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to add to her capital earmarked to buy merchandise consisting of frozen fish and basic staple vegetables that are in high demand by her retailer customers.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 53 years old and very much wants to get ahead and improve her life. She lives with her family in her house, the same place where she has her business. She has a shop selling essentials like bread, drinks, frozen and canned products, dairy products, sweets, and more.

Until her sales have become stable, which she wants to considerably improve, Mbeyu is asking for a loan from Yehu, with which she can have the necessary money to be able to buy bigger quantities of foodstuffs, detergents, basic grains, paraffin, and other instant products.  This will benefit her shop by making it stronger so that people prefer her shop and it is the first choice for buying what they need for their home.

loans.use: to buy bigger quantities of foodstuffs, detergents, basic grains, paraffin, and other instant products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience learned how to sew at a young age and has dedicated most of her life to this activity. This has enabled her to acquire a great deal of experience, which has resulted in a reputation for offering products that are of the highest quality and above all, unequaled services. With a sewing workshop at the town center, Patience is able to generate income, contribute financially to her household, and provide her family with a better quality of life. She does repairs and sewing of new clothing at the same time.

She received a few orders some time ago, but has not been able to fulfill them due to a lack of capital to buy the materials that she needs. For this reason, she seeks to overcome this difficulty by requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials and sewing supplies that will allow her to complete her customers’ orders. Patience dreams of continuing to develop her business and gradually improving her business revenues. This will enable her to improve the facilities in her home and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and sewing supplies

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four children. Two of her children are still attending school. In 2009, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own home business. She’s a bread baker. She prepares bread and delivers it to her neighbors in town and the surrounding areas. Her husband, who works on his own, represents the main income source of the family. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase ingredients for the bread and better improve her business. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will earn her higher profits. In the future, she plans to diversify her products and, therefore, attract additional clients.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 59-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He has been working for a local company since 2008. He is the only source of income for his family. His wife is taking care of the house and the children as well. But Hussein’s income is not covering all their needs, especially his children’s educational fees. This is the reason he’s requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. In this way, he will be able to pay his children's school fees. His only goal is to insure a good education for his children until graduation and avoid facing financial problems for the family. One of his greatest dreams is to see his children achieve good positions.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his child who is in school. He has been in farming for over 10 years producing tea and milk, which he sells to the people in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse, which will help him get more produce and hence more income to boost his livelihood and pay for his child's education.

Unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a readily available market are his major challenges in farming.

George is grateful for the sincerity of Juhudi Kilimo's staff.

loans.use: To purchase materials do construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old, Lebanese man. He got engaged few years ago, waiting the perfect time to get married and have his own family. Meanwhile, he’s living with his parents and four siblings. His father is their main income provider. Ahmad is really ambitious, he seeks to grow very fast in his domain and better support his family. He opened his own pharmacy in 2009 and has his own, loyal customers. 

Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantity of medicines and renovate his pharmacy as well. He notes that this will allow him to respond to his clients rapidly. He plans to enlarge his pharmacy and open other braches, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantity of medicines and renovate his pharmacy as well

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия очень успешная женщина в своем селе.  Ее все уважают и знают как добросовестную и целеустремленную женщину. Ей 41 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Личная жизнь у нее не удачная, так как ее муж бросил ее с 3 детьми и даже не обеспечивает их нужными для проживания средствами. Зулфия очень трудно справляется с обеспечением детей. Хотя родители ей помогают, однако на помощь ей не прожить. С целью улучшения условия жизни Зулфия решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a very successful woman in her village. She is respected and known as a fair and purposeful woman. She is 41 years old. She is divorced and is raising three children. In her personal life she is not lucky, as her husband left her with three children, and does not even provide them with the necessary resources for living. It is difficult for Zulfiya to provide for the children. However her parents help her, even if she does not want help. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Zulfiya decided to set up her own business for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women and she received a certificate. Now she may organize her business and become successful in this area. 

Zulfiya would like to set up a business of growing agricultural crops, as she has experience in this type of business. From the income received she plans to provide her children with a good education and proper food. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for setting up a new business

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila lives in Gyumri town with her husband and 3 children. She works at local school as a teacher and her husband Artur is a taxi driver. Lyudmila’s elder daughter studies at Armenian-Russian Slavonic University in the department of Finance and Credit. 
Together with her husband, Lyudmila works hard to sustain her family’s living. Unfortunately this family’s current income doesn’t allow them to pay for their daughter’s tuition. So Lyudmila has applied for this loan of 230,000 AMD, to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Surayyo

texts.ru: Сурайё жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Сурайё у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она портниха. Этим видом деятельности Сурайё занимается 7 лет. Она берет кредит для ремонта дома и приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы предоставлять качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Surayyo is a resident of the Gissar region. She is 36 years old and married. She has two children. Surayyo works from home, sewing national dresses. She is a seamstress. She has been working with this type of activity for 7 years. 

Surayyo takes a loan to repair the house and to purchase a new sewing machine, in order to provide quality services.

loans.use: to repair her house and purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mahfurat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Махфурат является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Так как ее муж умер, она осталась без кормился, и она должна справляться с расходами сама. Махфурат решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктовых товаров. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions force a person to focus all their efforts and make use of all existing resources. Mahfurat is one of these individuals who try to improve living conditions and boost the economic condition of the family. She is a widow and is raising a child. When her husband died, she was left with no food and she had to cope with the costs herself. 

Mahfurat decided to set up her own business for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she can set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of buying and selling food products. From the income received, she plans to improve her living conditions. 

Mahfurat requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of products, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase food products for setting up a new business

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umasi is grateful for the support she got from the previous loan. She says that her business is doing well and that she can now count on good results from her previous investments. She has been able to improve her standard of living. Umasi wants to make some improvements to her house, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing. She will also buy assorted nails, timbers, etc. She thanks Kiva lenders and Yehu for entrusting her with loans.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, assorted nails, timbers, etc. to improve her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is from the town of Samburu. She is married and has five grown children. She is the proprietor of a mini-store, where she sells drinks, flour, basic grains, and other household items. She began with a small business and later, little by little, grew to where she is today, thanks to her self-sacrifice.

Rodah comments that, thanks to this work, she can keep up her home and cover the expenses that arise in her home on a daily basis. She says that she would like to be able to continue with this business, as she has good sales, and the business generates a good income for her.

Rodah is requesting a loan for the purchase of drinks, flour, sugar, rice, and other things, with which she will be able to stock up her business. In this way, she will have everything in her store for any customer, whatever they need.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, rice, and other things to sell in her mini-store.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 31-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Najla, a beautiful young woman. They have only two children, who are still studying. Rabih is a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He works non-stop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2000. He is also specialized in installing solar systems. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which makes his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his plumbing tools. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him start his new project properly. This is how Rabih works to collect higher revenues and help his family live a very comfortable life away from struggle.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing tools and start a new project properly.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 26-year-old proactive student. She lives in Baghramyan village in the Ararat region with her family. Sona studies at the Armenian State University, in the faculty of Philosophy and Psychology. She is in her fourth course.
